Package controller

Class MainScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.MainScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class MainScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class is the main screen where the user can add, modify, or delete parts or products. Can exit the application from this screen.

      • searchParts

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> searchParts​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        This method searches by part ID or part name from the parts table.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - - This event handler searches the parts either by ID or name from the parts table.
        Returns:
        - This returns the search results for a part ID or part Name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - This IO Exception is thrown if an error occurs.

      • modifyPart

        void modifyPart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
         throws java.io.IOException
        This method switches to the modify part screen. --- COMPATIBLE FEATURE EXTENDING FUNCTIONALITY TO THE NEXT VERSION OF THE APPLICATION - In the next version, it would be a great feature to introduce the ability for the end-user to be able to double click a part from the parts table without first having to click the the modify part button. The existing way for the end user to be able to click a part first and then click the modify part button would still exist in the new version. This new feature would give the end user a faster, simpler way to modify a part by double clicking on a part from the parts table without the need of clicking the modify part button first.
        Parameters:
        event - - This event handler opens up the modify part screen.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - This IO Exception occurs if an error occurs.

      • deletePart

        public void deletePart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        This method deletes a selected part from the parts table.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - - This event handler deletes a selected part from the parts table.

      • searchProduct

        public java.lang.Object searchProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        This method searches by product ID or product name from the products table.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - - This event handler searches a product by ID or by name.
        Returns:
        Inventory.getAllProducts() Method
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - This IO Exception occurs if an error occurs.

      • modifyProduct

        void modifyProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
            throws java.io.IOException
        This method selects a specific part and then switches to the modify product screen for updating. --- COMPATIBLE FEATURE EXTENDING FUNCTIONALITY TO THE NEXT VERSION OF THE APPLICATION - In the next version, it would be a great feature to introduce the ability for the end-user to be able to double click a product from the products table without first having to click the the modify product button. The existing way for the end user to be able to click a product first and then click the modify product button would still exist in the new version. This new feature would give the end user a faster, simpler way to modify a product by double clicking on a product from the products table without the need of clicking the modify product button first.
        Parameters:
        event - - This event handler opens the modify product screen.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - This IO Exception occurs if an error occurs.

      • deleteProduct

        public void deleteProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        This method deletes a selected product from the products table view (only if it has no associated parts) assigned to it.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - - This event handler deletes a selected product from the products table.

      • exitButton

        void exitButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
         throws java.io.IOException
        This method exits the Inventory Management System program.
        Parameters:
        event - - This event handler exits the application.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - This throws an IOExcetion if an error occurs.

      • update

        public boolean update​(int partID,
                      InHouse Part)
        This method updates the results when user changes the text.
        Parameters:
        partID - - This partId is an integer passed into the update method to get all parts for the parts table.
        Part - - The Part is the InHouse part to be populated in the parts table.
        Returns:
        - This returns true or false.

      • filter

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> filter​(java.lang.String name)
        This method returns filtered results from an Observable List in Inventory Class by Part Name.
        Parameters:
        name - - This name is the string name of the parts from the observable array list.
        Returns:
        - This returns the Inventory get all filtered parts for the parts table.

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        This initializes the parts table on the main screen and populates it.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - - This url is used to initialize the parts and products table.
        resourceBundle - - This resourceBundle is used to assist in populating the parts and products table.
